subject: Re: WOUnit
msgSnippet: Hi Michael I am currently trying to fit it into my development cycle. Being a newbie in unit testing it s being hard to me to do it, but who said that life
messageBody:
Hi Michael

I am currently trying to fit it into my development cycle. Being a newbie in unit testing it's being hard to me to do it, but who said that life have to be easy?

Seriously, the current version available is for WO 4.0, numbered 0.9, and it's a somehow abandoned project. 'Somehow' means that the author (Michael Jonhston) said that he is more interested into develop a functional testing framework rather than a unit testing one right now.
I have made the porting from 4.0 version to 5.0, the one I'm using. About the use of unit tests in WO there's a thread in the omnigroup list that I figure you have read.

You can e-mail me for any question. I'll be glad of sharing my testing pains with anybody :).

Santi

--- In junit@y..., Michael Finney <finney@A...> wrote:
> I hear there is a WOUnit in town somewhere. It is for the WebObjects
> world.
>
> http://www.omnigroup.com/mailman/archive/webobjects-dev/2000-December/005502.html
>
> Anyone know more about it and if it is dead?
> Michael
